data.title: Best vegetarian restaurant in New Haven
data.text:
Always the go to place when in New Haven. I have had lunch and dinner as well as deserts. Everything is great. Love the falafel, enchiladas, quiches. Menu is huge. The deserts are big enough for 2 people to share. They have the best coffee. It is not a large place so if you go at prime time it takes a bit to get a table. 
This place is a New Haven staple and has been around for years. Don't miss it when you next visit.

data.title: Amazing dessert treats
data.text: My friend bought me a gluten-free cupcake and it was absolutely delicious. I have personally haven't had the opportunity to visit Claire's, but from what I've tasted and heard this is a pretty terrific place to go! I especially love that there are gluten-free options for people to select.

data.title: Cozy Vegetarian Restaurant
data.text: First time I was there.  We had the Topo Gigio which is roasted portobello caps and eggplant rounds, red onion, mozzarella, with tomato and garlic oil.  This is served on crispy chabetta bread.  Delicious!  Quick cafeteria style service.  They also have a great selections of teas and desserts.

data.title: Fantastic Food, Great Service, Lithuanian Coffee Cake Is #1.
data.text: Claire's Lithuanian Coffee Cake is fantastic -- for breakfast with coffee! Friends in town for the Yale Glee Club's 155th reunion weekend could not have picked a better place for amazing food with the best service in town. Feels and tastes like you are in your Mom's kitchen. A New Haven classic. If you are visiting New Haven, be certain to visit more than once. The menu is extensive and every dish is delicious! I'm a carnivore and I do not notice that I am eating vegan. No joke. Claire's is a perfect spot for a quick bite or a lingering meal.

data.title: Best soups!
data.text: I had tasted 3 different soups and I liked them all. They come with delicious mini bread loaf. Salads were ok. The Lithuanian coffee cake is to die for.

data.title: Excellent vegetarian/organic/healthy food center
data.text: Absolutely fantastic vegetarian place with great flavored dishes from salads, main courses, cakes, smoothies or anything you fancy for breakfast, brunch or take-out. Although it is not "cheap" the quality is excellent and the size of the portions is generous and fulfilling. Highly recommend Sunday' s brunch (be aware: it gets crowded) or get a take out bag full of smart food to eat at home. It is one of the favorite places for locals.

data.title: I want one of EVERYTHING!!
data.text: I went to this delicious establishment for the first time with a friend for lunch. At first it was a bit over whelming. There are so many choices, all of which either looked or sounded amazing. I ended up with an  iced tea, the empanada special and cauliflower fritter.  For dessert I indulged with a  vanilla chai, and a banana raspberry cupcake. I ended up taking home a portion of each home and had it for lunch the next day...still tasty! Loved all the organic ingredients! My only negative is that I thought it was a bit on the pricey side, especially since it's vegetarian but I guess this is the trend now so $$$. I would def recommend checking it out if you're in the area!

data.title: Quintessential New England cafe
data.text: No meats here. For you bacon lovers you will have to make do with soy bacon. It's kind of like eating popcorn-flavored jelly bellies - similar taste, maybe ... but definitely not the real thing. With that caveat out of the way, know that this is a delightful vegetarian restaurant with robust pastries and mini-loafs of seasonal breads. Coffees to match any palette. Directly across the street from Yale on Chapel, it feels much more "homey" and welcoming than other bakeries nearby, not taking anything away from the others. This is where Rory Gilmore would eat if she were really attending Yale (and not just a TV character from a decade ago) and wanted a taste of small town home in Stars Hollow, Connecticut.

data.title: This place is a mainstay in New Haven and for good reason.
data.text: This place is a mainstay in New Haven and for good reason. It has a delightful atmosphere, the servers are pleasant and efficient. The long line at lunch ( that moves rather quickly) is a testament to the great food. Ate there two times and then stopped just to eat there on my way through from Mystic. A gem!!

data.title: So many wonderful options
data.text: We were very pleased to find a vegetarian café that offered gluten free options, even though none of us are either vegetarian or require gluten free. These are simply the choices we sometimes want. Claire's really delivered. I loved their bakery with so many creative cakes, like blueberry lemon lavender coffee cake. I loved having mulled cider as a drink option, or Russian Fruit tea. And if you're a carnivore, you'll likely never know what you are missing. It's all good.

data.title: Fantastic smoothies
data.text: Stopped off for a smoothie and carrot cake. I chose the Power Surge smoothie,which was a meal within it self and refreshed me after a long shopping trip. Carrot cake was home made and delicious. I will be back for one of the wide variety of breakfasts in the next few days. If you are a veggie or vegan or just want some really delicious wholesome food at good prices this is the place for you.

data.title: The long wait was well worth it!
data.text: Since I had dined at Claire's last year on my visit to Yale, I decided to go in for brunch on a Sunday mid-morning. As has been my experience, the line to order was a bit long, but I anticipated that and waited patiently for my turn. I was warmly greeted by the cashier who took my order of quiche and pumpkin soup, and I found a table to wait for my food. Twenty-five minutes later, my beautiful brunch arrived. The soup was delicious, but I would have liked it a bit hotter; the temperature did NOT take away from my enjoyment of the soup. My quiche was perfect and the accompanying salad, divine. And the loaves of bread? To diet for!!! Overall, the meal was delicious, service as fast as could be expected, and the atmosphere comfortable and casual. I love this place!

data.title: School trip linch
data.text:
Great choices of healthy food for anyone
Little pricy but is new haven
Service great and a very clean place
Easy to locate in new haven - middle of yale activities

data.title: Ok Breakfast
data.text: We came in for a simple breakfast which is more or less what we got. The toast with smashed avo is supposed to be a simple dish but the avocado wasn't ripe enough to be smashed. The omelette with fillings was fine but the toast it came with wasn't really toasted. The smoothies we ordered were fine and service was fast.

data.title: Excellent brunch with many vegan options
data.text:
We had a delicious brunch at Claire's today.
Decently worth coming into New Haven for, the orange Juice was delicious the coffee perfect,and the salads and avocado sandwich hit the spot.
Excellent!

data.title: Great selection of baked goods!
data.text: We stopped here for a coffee break and ordered their signature coffee cake and fried portobello mushrooms. Both were amazingly good. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit there. I had read various glowing articles on this restaurant and I was not disappointed.

data.title: A Treasure in New Haven , Best of all Worlds
data.text:
Oh walk in see the busy people and guests , old style furniture , Vast Menu to satisfy even the Meaters ( No Meat) yet tasty , Fresh Made , Great service ! , They  take your dietary needs seriously. Please let us know if your meal needs to be vegan, gluten free, or if you have any other dietary restrictions. Kosher Certification. Organic 
ALSO Has a Large Catering Menu to suit your needs , made to the same standards   
Check Their Website !!, Great Oatmeal - my favorite , Breakfast ,Lunch , Specials , 
Can't go Wrong !! Enjoy !  V = Vegan VO = Vegan/No Cholesterol Option GF= Gluten Free Option.

data.title: Very friendly, inexpensive vegetarian restaurant
data.text: We were there for breakfast.  They offer nice size breakfasts for all sized.  As it seems to be favorite for Yale students, the place can get crowded.  The service staff was awesome and the pancakes and scrambled tofu were delicious.  We will be back next time we are in Yale.

data.title: Loved It
data.text:
I had eaten here once before but did not review it. This was my second trip. My daughters are vegan and huge fans. I am not so was skeptical. My first trip, I had a vegetarian BLT complete with soy bacon … it was outstanding. I could not believe how good the bacon was … and then the fact it was soy, was a nice benefit, I could eat without guilt. On this particular trip, my two daughters and son in law went for breakfast. 

I was quite surprised at how many breakfast items were on the menu that were healthy. I went with the two organic eggs, soy sausage and topped with whole whet toast and banana on the side. I could not believe how good the sausage was …. Hard to believe it was soy. I completed my meal with organic green tea with pomegranate. The place was certainly hopping with a line out the door. 

Everyone was nice, the crowd was friendly and it was a great ambience, definitely worth a return visit. We even met Claire ... she couldn't be nicer !!

data.title: Not what I expected and not in a good way.
data.text: Ordered the Flatbread Vegan Margherita Pizza.  It basicaly was a Tortilla Shell with sauce and cheese on it. Misrepresentation at the fullest.  I don't think that is what Flatbread is. However it WAS FLAT. Ugh.  Also ordered the California Burger, their homemade vegan burger topped with lettuce, tomato and guacamole.  When I asked for ketchup, I was told to take it off another patrons table as they had only one squeeze bottle for the whole restaurant. The roll it was served on was past its prime, quite stale and dry.  We sat outside and the girl that brought our food out to us, plopped it onto the table as if she was feeding cattle. So rude.  Being vegan, I tried to like it here, wanted to give it a chance. Total waste of time and money.  Learned my lesson.  Sticking to Edge of the Woods, ION, and G-Zen.  Sad, very bad experience.
